page.title: 03Public Health
page.content: A modern environmental health department has an advisory and enforcing role in matters relating to the health of the inhabitants.The evolution of public health law is tied up with the concept of nuisance,i.e. something which affects or prevents someone's exercise or enjoyment of certain rights. In 1984 in the Bootle area approximately 1500 complaints were made to the department which resulted in 388 statutory notices being served.Court proceedings,for failure to comply with notices,were instigated in two cases. The presence of vermin,known vectors of disease,is controlled by the local authority and about 2000 premises were treated,in the Bootle area in 1984,for the presence of vermin(rats,mice and cockroaches).
